text:
I don't count it a burden whatever
to have to care for her

I need to do everything, from the moment she
gets up

to the moment she goes to bed, I do absolutely
everything.

I clean her teeth, I shower, dress, everything.
But Its a priveledge, I count it a great privilege

to care for this one
that I have loved all of these years and continue
to love.

This is the year where we will celebrate our
fiftieth wedding anniversary.

Our story has been a lovely story. I first
saw her when she was eight years old and her

brother became my best friend.
We grew up together and as we grew up yeh
she was there.

And I knew that she use to stare at me when
I was playing footy with her brother and another

friend
and when we use to ride bikes and she kept
staring at me, but I wasn't interested.

I was seventeen she was sixteen, I saw her
dulled up, dressed up and she had an A-line

dress on and BOOM it was gone. She was the
one for me then, absolutely.

When we first started dating, I use to ride
my bike from where I lived to where she was,

and that was about five kilometres on a saturday
afternoon

because it was the only chance we had to get
together.

and it was hair wash day for her. And she
used a special cream in her hair for shampoo

and I can still smell it,
because that smell was so particular so nice,
it was just absolutely special.

We had a bike and I use to ride everywhere
on my bike and then Glad had a bike as well

and we put a baby chair on the front of her
bike and so we carried our babies around on

the bike with her as well
Yeh bikes been part of our lives, and I guess
that has something to do with us now.

Round about 2004-5 I began to notice there
were things going wrong.

She was finaly diagnosed with the horrible
disease of Alzheimer's.

Having lived overseas I knew that with a bike
you could do lots of things
so I had a bike made, a bike chair made.

We take it to the beach and ride along beside
the beach.And as we do that we see lots of

people, a lot of people come and talk to us
because it's a unique thing

nobody else has a bike chair quite like that
one.

I am determined to care for her every need,
every need.

You see God has loved us so unconditionally
and I understand that God has put his love

in my heart.
and because I realise how much God has loved

me
that's how I too can love my lovely wife.

She has done so much for me over all of these
years and

now she can't but I can, and I can return
her love.

And it's a love that well to me means I can
do everything for her.

Shes my Princess and I am her William and
we would'nt have it any other way,

would you have it any other way? No. No not
at all . We love each other.
